intro: Kohautia confusa, commonly known as the New Zealand starfruit, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a distinctive appearance with its yellowish-green leaves and small, star-shaped fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
